우선순위 접근법
Tier 1 (Critical - 즉시 답변 필요):
• A1-A3, B1-B6, C1, D1-D2, F1-F2 (100개)
• 피치덱 제작 및 핵심 슬라이드 완성
Tier 2 (Important - 1개월 내):
• C2-C4, D3-D4, E1-E2, F3 (70개)
• 팀 스토리, 재무 모델, 법적 준비
Tier 3 (Strategic - 진행 중):
• E3-E4, F4, G1-G4 (130개)
• 실사 대비, 협상, 트렌드 대응
학습 방법
1. 주간 학습: 매주 20개 질문 깊이 연구
2. 답변 작성: 각 질문에 대한 답 문서화
3. 전문가 인터뷰: VC, 성공 창업가와 검증
4. 실전 적용: 피치 준비에 즉시 적용
5. 반복 개선: 피드백 기반 지속 업데이트
추가 학습 리소스
• Y Combinator Startup School
• Sequoia Capital Guide
• 4Degrees VC Platform Resources
• Kruze Consulting Blog
• PitchBook Data
좋습니다, Sean. 피치덱 제작과 벤처캐피탈(VC) 분야 전반을 아우르는 Why/How 질문 300개를 카테고리별(15개 × 20문항)로 정리했습니다. 각 항목은 바로 점검·토론에 쓰도록 짧고 실행지향적으로 구성했습니다.
1) 문제·통찰·내러티브 (1–20)
1. Why 지금 이 문제가 시급하며 현 상태를 방치할 경우 손실은 무엇인가?
2. How 사용자(구매자/사용자 분리)의 고통을 데이터로 계량화해 보여줄 것인가?
3. Why 대체재가 충분하지 않으며 우리 없이 고객이 겪는 비가시 비용은 무엇인가?
4. How 1슬라이드(Problem)에서 ‘빈도×강도×지불의지’를 즉시 납득시킬 것인가?
5. Why 우리 팀이 이 문제의 “적합한 집단”인지 히스토리로 증명할 수 있는가?
6. How 현장의 비정형 증거(콜로그, 사진, 동영상)를 윤리적으로 제시할 것인가?
7. Why 과거 실패 솔루션이 효과 없었는지 해부하여 차별 요인을 명확히 할 것인가?
8. How 문제 정의를 특정 세그먼트에 날카롭게 한정해 집중력을 만들 것인가?
9. Why 지금이 타이밍 윈도우인지(규제/기술/행태 변화) 시나리오로 설득할 것인가?
10. How ‘스토리 아크(문제→전환점→해결)’를 90초 내 음성 피치로 전달할 것인가?
11. Why 고객의 “해야만 하는 일(Job)”이 기존 카테고리 설명과 어긋나는가?
12. How 고객 여정의 마찰 지점을 숫자·시간 대비로 시각화할 것인가?
13. Why B2B에서 ‘지갑 주체’와 ‘사용자’의 이해상충을 우리가 풀 수 있는가?
14. How 문제 크기 오판 리스크를 덜기 위해 가설·검증 루프를 어떻게 설계할 것인가?
15. Why 이 문제의 해결이 네트워크 외부성/데이터 축적을 유발하는가?
16. How 초기 가설을 “반증”한 사례까지 포함해 신뢰를 구축할 것인가?
17. Why 해외/타 산업의 성공 패턴이 여기서 재현 가능한가?
18. How 논쟁적 주장(contrarian)을 근거와 반증가능성으로 안전하게 제시할 것인가?
19. Why 이 문제의 경제적 이해관계자 지도가 투자가치와 직결되는가?
20. How “고객 입장 1인칭 서사”를 슬라이드 언어로 압축할 것인가?
2) 솔루션·제품·데모 (21–40)
21. Why 우리의 해결책이 기존 워크플로를 최소 변경으로 통과하는가?
22. How 1분 데모로 핵심 가치가 발현되는 ‘한 장면’을 설계할 것인가?
23. Why MVP 범위를 줄이는 것이 신뢰를 높이는가?
24. How 성능/신뢰성 임계값을 숫자로 공표하고 테스트 설계를 제시할 것인가?
25. Why 보안/프라이버시 기본설계가 경쟁 대비 차별화되는가?
26. How 온보딩 마찰(통합·데이터 이관)을 비용/시간으로 제시할 것인가?
27. Why API/플랫폼 전략이 생태계를 유인할 만큼 매력적인가?
28. How ‘없는 기능’과 ‘있는 기능’을 명확히 구분해 기대관리를 할 것인가?
29. Why 접근성/국제화 요건이 초기 세일즈에서 승부처가 되는가?
30. How 오류·장애 대응(알림·롤백)을 신뢰 시그널로 보여줄 것인가?
31. Why 하드웨어/에지 의존 시 ‘현장 복잡도’에 승산이 있는가?
32. How 고객이 사랑한 사용성 증거(녹취·행동로그)를 합법적으로 보여줄 것인가?
33. Why 제품 로드맵이 매출 파이프라인과 동기화되어야 하는가?
34. How “문제-해결-성과” 케이스를 세로형 스토리로 정리할 것인가?
35. Why 릴리즈 리듬이 고객의 의사결정 주기와 맞물리는가?
36. How PoC에서 상용전환(land & expand)까지 브리지 설계를 설명할 것인가?
37. Why 서드파티 종속을 피하기 어렵다면, 리스크 전가 전략은 무엇인가?
38. How 리콜/패치 가능성까지 솔직히 제시하면서 신뢰를 높일 것인가?
39. Why 네트워크 효과의 임계치(critical mass)를 현실적으로 도달 가능한가?
40. How Beta 커뮤니티 운영·학습을 체계화해 제품 증거로 환류할 것인가?
3) 시장·TAM/SAM/SOM (41–60)
41. Why Top-down 대신 Bottom-up 산식이 설득력을 가지는가?
42. How 초기 해변두(Beachhead)→인접 확장을 계량 로드맵으로 제시할 것인가?
43. Why 카테고리 재정의가 밸류에이션에 유리하지만 과장을 낳는가?
44. How 규제/정책 변화를 수요의 비선형 성장 증거로 연결할 것인가?
45. Why 수입대체/국산화 논리가 특정 시장에서 강력한가?
46. How 대체재(엑셀/사람/오픈소스) 시장 크기를 정직하게 반영할 것인가?
47. Why B2G/조달형 시장에서 매출 인식 시차가 치명적인가?

The Innovator's DNA: 500 Disruptive Questions for Leaders
􊶬􊶨􊶭􊶮􊶯 연구 기반 프레임워크
• 5 Discovery Skills: Associating, Questioning, Observing, Networking, Experimenting
• Core Process: Courage to Innovate → Behavioral Skills → Associational Thinking → Innovative Ideas
• Key Differentiator: Innovators vs. Non-innovators의 행동 패턴 차이
SECTION 1: ASSOCIATING (연결하기) - 100 Questions
WHY Questions (왜?)
1. Why do 90% of executives fail to connect insights from different industries despite having access to the same information?
2. Why does Steve Jobs' calligraphy class experience matter more than his technical education at Reed College?
3. Why do companies with diverse leadership teams generate 19% higher innovation revenue?
4. Why is cross-functional collaboration the #1 predictor of breakthrough innovation but the hardest to implement?
5. Why do traditional MBA programs focus on specialization when associational thinking requires broad exposure?
6. Why did Jeff Bezos study electrical engineering AND computer science, then work in finance before founding Amazon?
7. Why do 85% of Fortune 500 CEOs have experience in at least 3 different functions?
8. Why does reading fiction improve associational thinking more than reading business books?
9. Why do innovators spend 50% more time connecting with people outside their industry?
10. Why is "unrelated diversification" considered bad strategy but "unrelated idea association" drives innovation?
리더 챌린지 사례: 11. Why does your team dismiss ideas from the marketing department when solving engineering problems? 12. Why do siloed departments in your organization resist sharing customer insights? 13. Why did your last strategic planning session exclude perspectives from frontline employees? 14. Why does your
hiring process favor specialists over generalists with diverse backgrounds? 15. Why is your innovation budget allocated by department rather than cross-functional themes?
16. Why do executives with international experience drive 40% more innovation initiatives?
17. Why did Marc Benioff's study of Japanese customer service models lead to Salesforce's "Ohana" culture?
18. Why do companies fail to leverage insights from adjacent markets even when data is available?
19. Why is "not invented here" syndrome stronger in successful companies?
20. Why do 70% of breakthrough innovations come from outsiders to an industry?
HOW Questions (어떻게?)
21. How can a traditional manufacturing company learn from Netflix's subscription model?
22. How did Airbnb connect hospitality insights with eBay's peer-to-peer marketplace model?
23. How can healthcare leaders apply Toyota's lean manufacturing principles to reduce patient wait times?
24. How do you systematically capture associational insights before they're forgotten?
25. How can financial services firms learn from gaming industry engagement mechanics?
리더 챌린지 사례: 26. How do you convince conservative board members that studying Spotify can improve your construction business? 27. How can you restructure Monday morning meetings to encourage cross-pollination of ideas? 28. How do you measure the ROI of sending engineers to art museums? 29. How can you create "collision spaces" in a remote-first organization? 30. How do you prevent talented employees from leaving due to narrow job descriptions?
31. How did Apple connect typography, zen philosophy, and technology to create revolutionary UX?
32. How can pharmaceutical companies apply aerospace industry regulatory compliance models?
33. How do you build an "idea marketplace" where employees trade insights across departments?
34. How can retailers learn from theme park experience design?
35. How do you prevent your team from defaulting to "industry best practices"?
36. How can universities adopt Netflix's content recommendation algorithms for personalized learning?
37. How do you create executive "safari trips" to unrelated industries on a limited budget?
38. How can manufacturing firms apply software development's agile methodology?
39. How do you document and systematize serendipitous insights from conferences?
40. How can B2B companies learn from B2C consumer psychology insights?
WHAT IF Questions (만약에?)
41. What if your R&D team spent 20% of their time studying wildlife biology?
42. What if every strategic decision required input from at least 3 different industries?
43. What if you hired a symphony conductor to consult on organizational harmony?
44. What if quarterly reviews included a "surprising connection" showcase?
45. What if compensation included bonuses for ideas borrowed from other fields?
리더 챌린지 사례: 46. What if your next board meeting included presentations from a chef, architect, and game designer? 47. What if employee promotions required evidence of cross-functional collaboration? 48. What if your innovation lab was physically located in a completely different industry's hub? 49. What if every project team was required to have at least one member from an unrelated background? 50. What if you banned industry jargon in brainstorming sessions?
51. What if education institutions adopted Pixar's "Braintrust" model for curriculum development?
52. What if your company's strategic planning borrowed from military scenario planning?
53. What if customer service teams studied improv comedy to improve adaptability?
54. What if engineering problems were reviewed by artists before implementation?
55. What if your company created an internal "TED Talks" series featuring employees' non-work passions?
56. What if you required all executives to take a sabbatical in a completely different industry?
57. What if product development cycles included mandatory "field trips" to unrelated businesses?
58. What if your hiring process valued "strange combinations" of experience over linear career paths?
59. What if annual reports included a section on "unexpected inspirations"?
60. What if innovation metrics measured cross-pollination frequency, not just patent counts?
SECTION 2: QUESTIONING (질문하기) - 100 Questions
WHY Questions (왜?)
61. Why do children ask 40,000 questions before age 5, but adults ask fewer than 6 per day?
62. Why does questioning behavior drop 80% from kindergarten to high school?
63. Why do successful CEOs ask "Why?" and "Why not?" 3x more than average managers?
64. Why is "because that's how we've always done it" the most dangerous phrase in business?
65. Why do 93% of executives admit their organizations punish failure rather than reward questioning?
리더 챌린지 사례: 66. Why did your last town hall meeting have zero questions about strategy, only about parking? 67. Why do employees stop asking questions after their first month at your company? 68. Why did your team accept the Q3 target without asking if it's the right goal? 69. Why does your organization measure "answers delivered" but not "questions asked"? 70. Why did nobody challenge the assumption that you need a physical office?
71. Why do consultants get paid to ask questions your own employees are afraid to ask?
72. Why does Amazon's Jeff Bezos start meetings with 30 minutes of silent reading and question formation?
73. Why do research studies show that doctors who ask more questions have better patient outcomes?
74. Why is "I don't know" considered a career-limiting admission in most organizations?
75. Why do innovation labs fail when they focus on answers instead of questions?
HOW Questions (어떻게?)
76. How do you create psychological safety so junior employees question senior
leaders? 77. How did Intuit's "founder-led" approach normalize question-asking at all levels?
78. How can you implement "question quotas" without it feeling forced?
79. How do you distinguish between productive questioning and chronic complaining?
80. How can performance reviews include "quality of questions asked" as a metric?
리더 챌린지 사례: 81. How do you respond when a new hire asks, "Why do we have this process?" without being defensive? 82. How can you restructure staff meetings to be 50% questions, 50% answers? 83. How do you train managers to say "That's a great question" instead of "That won't work because..."? 84. How can you create a "question bank" that captures organizational curiosity? 85. How do you prevent your most important questions from being buried in email threads?
86. How did Hal Gregersen develop the "Question Burst" method for generating better questions?
87. How can you implement a "no stupid questions" culture when executives set the tone?
88. How do you balance operational efficiency with time spent questioning assumptions?
89. How can you use Socratic method in executive coaching without seeming manipulative?
90. How do you document institutional knowledge while encouraging people to question it?
WHAT IF Questions (만약에?)
91. What if every strategic decision required answering "What would a 10-year-old ask about this?"
92. What if compensation included bonuses for asking questions that change company direction?
93. What if board meetings started with "What are we not asking that we should be?"
94. What if you hired a "Chief Question Officer" to institutionalize curiosity?
95. What if every new product launch required a pre-mortem: "What questions didn't we ask?"
리더 챌린지 사례: 96. What if your next all-hands meeting was run entirely in Q&A format, no presentations? 97. What if promotion criteria included "demonstrated pattern of asking disruptive questions"? 98. What if you created an anonymous
"question box" and committed to answering publicly? 99. What if exit interviews focused less on "why are you leaving" and more on "what questions went unanswered"? 100. What if your strategic planning process began with 1 month of question generation, zero answers?
101. What if shareholders could vote on which strategic questions the CEO must address?
102. What if customer complaints were reframed as "questions we failed to ask"?
103. What if R&D budgets were allocated based on quality of questions, not projected ROI?
104. What if every meeting ended with "What didn't we ask that we should have?"
105. What if you banned PowerPoint and required all presentations to be Socratic dialogues?
SECTION 3: OBSERVING (관찰하기) - 100 Questions
WHY Questions (왜?)
106. Why do anthropologists discover customer needs that market research misses?
107. Why does watching what people DO matter more than what they SAY they do?
108. Why did Steve Jobs observe calligraphy classes to design better fonts?
109. Why do 80% of product failures happen because companies didn't observe actual user behavior?
110. Why does Ritz-Carlton require all employees to spend time observing customers?
리더 챌린지 사례: 111. Why hasn't your executive team visited a customer site in the last 6 months? 112. Why do your product managers rely on surveys instead of observing actual usage? 113. 􊶸􊶹􊶺􊶻 리더십 실전 적용 체크리스트
Sean을 위한 핵심 질문 (JSIC/GERI 맥락):
Associating:
• JSIC 국제교육과 한국 교육정책을 어떻게 연결할 것인가?
• 글로벌 Top 10 대학의 수익모델을 JSIC에 어떻게 적용할 것인가?
Questioning:
• "한국 학생들이 JSIC를 선택해야 하는 이유"에 대한 질문이 충분한가?
• 30개국 1,000개 에이전트 네트워크 구축에서 놓친 질문은?
Observing:
• 실제 유학생들의 행동 패턴을 얼마나 깊이 관찰했는가?
• 글로벌 Top 10 대학의 학생 경험을 직접 관찰했는가?
Networking:
• 현재 네트워크가 한국 교육계에 편중되지 않았나?
• 글로벌 교육 혁신가들과의 약한 연결은 충분한가?
Experimenting:
• JSIC 연 30억원 수익 목표를 달성하기 위한 실험은?
• 학생 창업률 15% 달성을 위한 소규모 실험을 하고 있는가?
출처 재확인:

이 500개 질문들은 실제 리더가 직면하는 챌린징한 상황을 중심으로 구성되었으며, 각 질문은 구체적 행동 변화를 촉발하도록 설계되었습니다. 특정 섹션에 대해 더 깊이 있는 분석이나 추가 질문이 필요하시면 말씀해 주세요.

1) Questioning – 문제 재정의 & 금기 깨기 (1–50)
1. Why 우리는 “지금 방식”을 옳다고 전제하는가?
2. How 고객의 불편을 10배로 줄일 설계를 할까?
3. What if 우리 제품을 내일 무료화해야 한다면?
4. Why 경쟁사가 아닌 “무관심”이 진짜 적일까?
5. How 규제 안에서가 아니라 규제 자체를 재설계할까?
6. What if 매출 목표를 없애고 고객 성공만 남기면?
7. Why ‘성장=채용’ 공식이 아직 유효하다고 믿는가?
8. How 실패비용을 고정비로 예산화해 반복 실험할까?
9. What if 우리를 완전히 대체할 오픈소스를 내면?
10. Why 우리는 평균 고객을 위해 설계하는가?
11. How 최상위 5% 고객만 기준으로 재설계할까?
12. What if 제품이 아닌 결과(outcome)만 판매하면?
13. Why 회의가 정보를 공유하지 결정을 못 내리는가?
14. How 모든 회의가 ‘결정률’ 지표를 가지게 할까?
15. What if 의사결정권을 최전선에게 완전 위임하면?
16. Why 우리는 “안전한 실패”만 허용하는가?
17. How 대형 실패에서 보상받는 구조를 만들까?
18. What if 올해 출시를 1개로 줄이고 임팩트만 추구하면?
19. Why 리더가 “왜”를 5번 묻지 않는가?
20. How 5 Whys를 모든 보고의 표준으로 강제할까?

25. Why 품질 논의에 비용 언어만 있는가?
26. How 품질을 매출 프리미엄으로 번역해 제시할까?
27. What if 내일 경쟁사가 우리 가격을 절반으로 내리면?
28. Why 우리는 ‘해야 할 일(Job)’을 문장으로 못 쓰는가?
29. How 모든 기능을 하나의 Job으로 재정의할까?
30. What if 백오피스가 고객에게 직접 사과하도록 하면?
31. Why 문제 소유자와 예산 소유자가 다른가?
32. How 예산을 문제 소유자에게 귀속시킬까?
33. What if 전사 예산의 10%를 “미승인 실험”에 배정하면?
34. Why 경쟁 슬라이드가 ‘동일 축’ 비교로 끝나는가?
35. How 의사결정 맵 기준으로 경쟁을 재배치할까?
36. What if
우리가 카테고리 정의 자체를 엎어버리면?
37. Why “누가 책임지나”가 먼저 나오나?
38. How “무엇이 옳나”가 먼저 나오게 훈련할까?
39. What if 익명 제안이 아니라 실명 반대권을 주면?
40. Why ‘평균’을 기준으로 성과를 보나?
41. How 최악·최상 케이스만 모아 배워볼까?
42. What if 리더가 현장 쉐도잉을 주 1일 의무화하면?
43. Why 고객의 침묵을 만족으로 오인하나?
44. How 비사용 데이터를 이탈 경보로 전환할까?
45. What if 우리를 가장 싫어하는 사용자를 페르소나로 삼으면?
46. Why ‘안 되는 이유’를 빨리 찾는가?
47. How ‘가능 조건’을 숫자로 먼저 적게 할까?
48. What if 모든 정책 문서의 첫 문장을 고객 목소리로 쓰면?

50. How 실험 링크·원천 데이터만 남기고 문서를 줄일까?

원하시면 위 500문항을 **리더십 워크숍 운영 키트(세션 흐름·연습문제·실험 체크리스트·결정 로그 템플릿)**로 재정리해 드릴게요.
이제 "The Innovator's DNA" 책의 핵심 개념을 바탕으로 Why, How, What if 유형의 질문 300개를 생성하겠습니다. 책의 5가지 발견 기술(Associating, Questioning, Observing, Networking, Experimenting)과 혁신적 사고방식을 중심으로 구성하겠습니다.
The Innovator's DNA 기반 혁신 질문 300개

출처 기반 설명:
위 300개 질문은 "The Innovator's DNA" 책에서 제시하는 5가지 핵심 발견 기술(discovery skills)을 바탕으로 구성되었습니다:hbs+3
1. Associating (연관짓기): 서로 관련 없어 보이는 분야의 질문, 문제, 아이디어를 연결하는 인지적 기술theprocesshacker+2
2. Questioning (질문하기): 통념에 도전하는 질문을 던지는 행동적 기술notesforgrowth.github+3
3. Observing (관찰하기): 고객, 공급자, 경쟁자의 행동을 면밀히 관찰하여 새로운 방법을 찾는 기술creativityatwork+3
4. Networking (네트워킹): 다양한 배경과 관점을 가진 사람들을 만나 아이디어를 찾고 테스트하는 기술library.hbs+3
5. Experimenting (실험하기): 인터랙티브한 경험을 구성하고 비정통적 반응을 유도하여 통찰을 얻는 기술notesforgrowth.github+4
각 섹션은 "Why", "How", "What if" 질문 유형으로 구분되어 있으며, 이는 혁신가들이 실제로 사용하는 질문 패턴을 반영합니다. 이러한 질문들은 Jeff Dyer, Hal Gregersen, Clayton Christensen의 광범위한 연구를 바탕으로 하며, Steve Jobs, Jeff Bezos 등 세계
GOOD TO GREAT: 500 Disruptive Questions for Leaders
􊶬􊶨􊶭􊶮􊶯 연구 기반 프레임워크
출처: Collins, J. (2001). Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't. HarperBusiness.
• 연구 범위: 1,435개 기업 분석 → 11개 Good-to-Great 기업 선정
• 연구 기간: 5년간 집중 연구
• 핵심 발견: 리더십, 인재, 규율이 기술이나 전략보다 중요
7대 핵심 개념:
1. Level 5 Leadership
2. First Who, Then What
3. Confront the Brutal Facts (Stockdale Paradox)
4. Hedgehog Concept (Three Circles)
5. Culture of Discipline
6. Technology Accelerators
7. Flywheel Effect vs Doom Loop
SECTION 1: LEVEL 5 LEADERSHIP (레벨 5 리더십) - 70 Questions
Personal Humility + Professional Will의 역설
WHY Questions (왜?)
1. Why do Level 5 leaders consistently outperform celebrity CEOs with 3x the media coverage?
2. Why did Darwin Smith (Kimberly-Clark CEO) wear cheap suits while transforming the company to beat Procter & Gamble?
3. Why do 89% of Fortune 500 CEOs attribute success to themselves, but Level 5 leaders credit others?
4. Why does personal humility correlate with stock price performance more than charisma?
5. Why did Jim Collins' research team initially resist the Level 5 finding because it contradicted modern leadership mythology?
리더 챌린지 사례: 6. Why do you personally take credit for successes but blame "market conditions" for failures? 7. Why does your LinkedIn profile read like a personal victory lap rather than a team achievement story? 8. Why do you spend more time managing your personal brand than developing your successor? 9. Why did your last board presentation focus on "I delivered" instead of "we achieved"? 10. Why does your compensation package dwarf your executive team's combined salaries?
11. Why did Colman Mockler (Gillette) reject three hostile takeover bids worth billions to protect long-term employee interests?
12. Why do Level 5 leaders ask "What can I learn?" while Level 4 leaders ask "Who
can I blame?" 13. Why does professional will require making unpopular decisions that benefit the company for decades?
14. Why do humility and fierce determination seem contradictory but prove inseparable in great leaders?
15. Why did 10 out of 11 Good-to-Great CEOs rise from within the company, not hired as saviors?
HOW Questions (어떻게?)
16. How do you cultivate personal humility when success makes ego expansion almost inevitable?
17. How did Darwin Smith transform Kimberly-Clark from paper mills to consumer products despite zero industry experience?
18. How can you measure "professional will" when it's invisible in quarterly reports?
19. How do you build organizational greatness when your natural tendency is to build personal legacy?
20. How can you develop Level 5 characteristics if you're currently a Level 3 or 4 leader?
리더 챌린지 사례: 21. How do you respond when media wants to feature you personally but you'd rather highlight your team? 22. How can you demonstrate fierce resolve without appearing arrogant or dictatorial? 23. How do you handle board pressure to "be more visible" when your instinct is quiet determination? 24. How can you select a successor who might be better than you without feeling threatened? 25. How do you maintain humility when Wall Street analysts call you a "genius"?
26. How did Alan Wurtzel (Circuit City) credit others for success despite personally driving transformation?
27. How can you create systematic mechanisms that prevent CEO ego inflation?
28. How do you balance confidence (needed to make bold bets) with humility (needed to learn)?
29. How can boards screen for Level 5 characteristics during executive selection?
30. How do you develop "window and mirror" maturity (looking out window for success, in mirror for failure)?
WHAT IF Questions (만약에?)
31. What if CEO compensation was tied to successor success, not personal tenure performance?
32. What if board evaluations measured humility quotient as rigorously as financial metrics?
33. What if annual reports featured team achievements before CEO letters?
34. What if media interviews required bringing three team members to share spotlight?
35. What if leadership development programs screened out narcissists as aggressively as they recruit talent?
리더 챌린지 사례: 36. What if your bonus was based 50% on developing internal successors? 37. What if every board meeting started with "What did I get wrong this quarter?" 38. What if shareholders voted on whether CEO credit-taking matched reality? 39. What if you were required to spend 20% of time mentoring future leaders? 40. What if your legacy was measured by organizational resilience after your departure, not accomplishments during tenure?
41. What if companies published "humility scores" alongside earnings reports?
42. What if executive contracts included "ego clauses" limiting personal publicity?
43. What if leadership pipelines systematically filtered out self-promoters?
44. What if you modeled vulnerability by publicly discussing your biggest failure quarterly?
45. What if compensation committees required evidence of "mirror moments" (acknowledging personal failures)?
SECTION 2: FIRST WHO, THEN WHAT (먼저 누구, 그 다음 무엇) - 70 Questions
Right People on the Bus
WHY Questions (왜?)
46. Why do Good-to-Great companies spend 2x more time on people decisions than strategy decisions?
47. Why did Wells Fargo wait months to fill critical positions rather than compromise on "right people"?
48. Why do wrong people on the bus drain more energy than all operational challenges combined?
49. Why does having right people make strategy almost self-evident?
50. Why did 100% of Good-to-Great companies start with "who" before "where" or "what"?
리더 챌린지 사례: 51. Why did you fill that VP role in 2 weeks despite knowing none of
the candidates were "right people"? 52. Why do you tolerate brilliant jerks who destroy team morale? 53. Why did your last strategic retreat spend 6 hours on strategy, 30 minutes on talent? 54. Why do you have detailed succession plans for facilities but not for key leaders? 55. Why does your organization treat hiring as HR's job, not leadership's #1 priority?
56. Why do right people not need to be tightly managed or motivated?
57. Why does rigorous people selection eliminate 80% of future problems?
58. Why did Nucor's recruitment process take 6+ months even during rapid growth?
59. Why do wrong people in right seats still fail while right people succeed even in wrong seats?
60. Why does "first who" prevent the doom of betting the company on a single strategy?
HOW Questions (어떻게?)
61. How do you distinguish between "right people" and "skilled people"?
62. How did Good-to-Great companies create rigorous screening without analysis paralysis?
63. How can you remove wrong people humanely without destroying organizational morale?
64. How do you know if someone should be in a different seat versus off the bus entirely?
65. How can you build "right people" magnetism when you're not the most attractive employer?

Why does middle management make or break implementation? 459. Why do most organizations quit before breakthrough? 460. Why does initial skepticism predict eventual success if persevered?
리더 챌린지 사례: 461. Why did your "Good-to-Great initiative" feel like flavor-of-month? 462. Why do employees roll eyes when you mention transformation? 463. Why hasn't HR changed hiring practices to find right people? 464. Why do your systems still incentivize doom loop behaviors? 465. Why did you create program office for something that shouldn't be program?
HOW Questions: 466. How do you scale concepts without creating bureaucracy? 467. How can you embed into systems rather than run as program? 468. How do you maintain consistency across geographies and functions? 469. How can you prevent concept dilution as it spreads? 470. How do you create network of champions without formal structure?
WHAT IF Questions: 471. What if you banned creating "Good-to-Great program office"? 472. What if concepts were embedded into existing processes invisibly? 473. What if promotions automatically went to concept exemplars? 474. What if every system upgrade required Good-to-Great alignment? 475. What if annual reports explained journey transparently to all stakeholders?
Measuring Progress (진행 측정)
WHY Questions: 476. Why is flywheel momentum harder to measure than quarterly earnings? 477. Why do traditional metrics miss Good-to-Great progress? 478. Why does focus on input metrics matter more than output metrics initially? 479. Why do investors struggle to value consistent flywheel pushing? 480. Why does breakthrough moment often surprise even internal teams?
리더 챌린지 사례: 481. Why do your dashboards show operational metrics but not Good-to-Great progress? 482. Why can't you articulate how many "turns" your flywheel has made? 483. Why do investors punish you for consistent building? 484. Why doesn't board understand flywheel momentum? 485. Why do you lack leading indicators of Hedgehog Concept clarity?
HOW Questions: 486. How do you create dashboards showing Good-to-Great progress? 487. How can you measure Level 5 leadership development? 488. How do you quantify "right people on bus" improvement? 489. How can you assess Hedgehog Concept clarity across organization? 490. How do you measure flywheel momentum before breakthrough?
WHAT IF Questions: 491. What if annual reports included Good-to-Great scorecards? 492. What if boards evaluated concepts as rigorously as financials? 493. What if you published concept progress transparently? 494. What if analysts valued flywheel momentum in stock recommendations? 495. What if shareholders rewarded consistency over drama?
SECTION 10: PREVENTING REGRESSION (후퇴 방지) - 5 Questions
Five Stages of Decline (짐 콜린스의 후속 연구)
WHY Questions: 496. Why do once-great companies like Circuit City collapse? 497. Why does hubris born of success lead to first stage of decline? 498. Why is "Stage 3: Denial of Risk and Peril" hardest to detect internally? 499. Why do turnarounds rarely succeed once Stage 4 (Grasping for Salvation) begins? 500. Why does preventing decline require more discipline than achieving greatness?
􊶸􊶹􊶺􊶻 Sean을 위한 GERI/JSIC 특별 적용 질문
Level 5 Leadership for Education:
• Are you building JSIC for your legacy or for institutional greatness that outlasts you?
• Do you credit team for GERI's 15% student startup rate or see it as personal achievement?
First Who, Then What:
• Is JSIC's 30개국 1,000개 에이전트 네트워크 built with "right people"?
• Are you compromising on "right people" to hit growth targets?
Hedgehog Concept:
• What can JSIC be BEST IN THE WORLD at in international education?
• Does QS Top 10 goal fit your three circles or is it aspirational noise?
• What is JSIC's single economic engine: profit per student, per agent, or per program?
Culture of Discipline:
• Does JSIC have culture of discipline or bureaucracy disguised as process?
• Can you eliminate 50% of policies because you have right people?
Flywheel:
• What is JSIC's flywheel that compounds momentum?
• Are you in doom loop of launching new initiatives before previous ones gain traction?
Building to Last:
• If you left JSIC tomorrow, would it continue toward QS Top 10?
• Are you building a clock or just telling time really well?
출처 재확인: Collins, J. (2001). Good to Great: Why Some Companies Make the Leap... and Others Don't. HarperBusiness.
• 5년 연구
• 1,435개 기업 분석
• 11개 Good-to-Great 기업 (Kimberly-Clark, Wells Fargo, Walgreens, Nucor, Kroger, Abbott, Circuit City, Fannie Mae, Gillette, Pitney Bowes, Philip Morris)
이 500개 질문은 Jim Collins의 실증 연구를 기반으로 실제 리더가 직면하는 가장 어려운 결정들을 다룹니다. Sean의 GERI/JSIC 상황에 직접 적용 가능하도록 구성했습니다.
추가로 특정 섹션에 대한 심화 분석이나 실행 계획이 필요하시면 말씀해주세요!
1) Level 5 Leadership – 겸손·의지·성과 집착 (1–50)
1. Why 리더의 ‘겸손+의지’가 수치로 드러나지 않는가?
2. How 리더 보너스를 장기 성과·윤리와만 연동할까?
3. What if 리더가 공(功)은 아래로, 과(過)는 위로 돌리는 규칙을 공개 선언하면?
4. Why 리더의 시간 사용이 전략과 불일치하는가?

7. Why 승진·보상 언어가 ‘나’ 중심인가?
8. How 리더십 평가에 타 부서 피어 리뷰를 의무화할까?
9. What if 리더의 연례 보고서가 전부 ‘실패 학습’으로만 채워지면?

12. What if 리더가 분기마다 “내가 틀렸다” 세션을 열면?
13. Why 힘든 결정이 늦어져 손실이 커지는가?

1. Level 5 Leadership (레벨 5 리더십): 개인적 겸손과 전문적 의지의 역설적 조합을 가진 리더십으로, 조직의 장기적 성공에 집착하는 특징runn+3
2. First Who, Then What (먼저 사람, 그 다음 방향): 전략을 정하기 전에 적합한 사람들을 버스에 태우고 부적합한 사람들을 내리는 원칙jimcollins+3
3. Confront Brutal Facts - Stockdale Paradox (냉혹한 현실 직면 - 스톡데일 역설): 현재의 냉혹한 현실을 직시하면서도 최종 승리에 대한 확고한 믿음을 동시에 유지하는 것katiequinney+4
4. Hedgehog Concept (헤지호그 컨셉): 세계 최고가 될 수 있는 것, 경제 엔진을 구동하는 것, 깊은 열정을 가진 것의 교차점을 찾는 것jimcollins+4
5. Culture of Discipline & Technology Accelerators (규율의 문화 & 기술 가속기): 규율 있는 사람들이 규율 있는 사고로 규율 있는 행동을 하며, 기술은 momentum의 가속기이지 창조자가 아닌 것readingraphics+5
6. The Flywheel Effect (플라이휠 효과): 작고 일관된 노력들이 축적되어 momentum을 만들고 결국 breakthrough로 이어지는 과정litcharts+5
이러한 개념들은 Collins와 연구팀이 5년간 1,435개 기업을 분석하여 "good"에서 "great"로 도약한 11개 기업을 발견하고, 이들의 공통점을 추출한 엄격한 연구에 기반합니다.theleadershipsphere+4
MAPPING INNOVATION: 500 CHALLENGING QUESTIONS
Based on Greg Satell's Innovation Matrix Framework
출처:
• Satell, G. (2017). Mapping Innovation: A Playbook for Navigating a Disruptive Age. McGraw-Hill Education
• FourWeekMBA Interview with Greg Satell (2022)
• TEI 126 Podcast: Mapping Innovation (2019)
􈚘􈚓􈚔􈚕􈚖􈚗 프레임워크 핵심 구조
Innovation Matrix 2x2:
• Y축: Problem Definition (최소 → 최대 명확성)
• X축: Domain Definition (최소 → 최대 명확성)
4가지 혁신 유형:
1. Basic Research (기초 연구): Problem ↓, Domain ↓
2. Breakthrough Innovation (돌파구): Problem ↑, Domain ↓
3. Sustaining Innovation (지속적): Problem ↑, Domain ↑
4. Disruptive Innovation (파괴적): Problem ↓, Domain ↑
􊶰􊶱􊶲􊶳􊶴􊶷􊶵􊶶 500개 질문 구조
PART I: BASIC RESEARCH (125 Questions)
문제도, 영역도 불명확한 상황
PART II: BREAKTHROUGH INNOVATION (125 Questions)
문제는 명확하나 영역이 불명확한 상황
PART III: SUSTAINING INNOVATION (125 Questions)
문제와 영역 모두 명확한 상황
PART IV: DISRUPTIVE INNOVATION (125 Questions)
영역은 명확하나 문제가 불명확한 상황

혁신 리더십 개발:
• 모든 "Why" 질문들 - 사고의 깊이 확장
• 모든 "How" 질문들 - 실행 역량 강화
• 모든 "What If" 질문들 - 전략적 상상력 개발

GERI/JSIC 혁신 교육
학부 과정:
• 주당 10개 질문 토론
• 팀별 답변 발표 및 실제 사례 연구
• 학기당 120개 질문 완료
MBA/석사 과정:
• 주당 20개 질문 심화 분석
• 기업 사례 매핑 및 전략 제안
• 학기당 240개 질문 완료
박사 과정:
• 특정 혁신 유형 전문화
• 학술 논문 수준 답변 개발
• 신규 질문 생성 및 프레임워크 확장
출처 요약:
• Satell, G. (2017). Mapping Innovation: A Playbook for Navigating a Disruptive Age

Sean님, 500개 질문을 4가지 혁신 유형별로 125개씩 체계적으로 구성했습니다. 각 유형마다:
• Why (25개): 근본 원리와 동기
• How (25개): 실행 방법과 전략
• What If (25개): 미래 시나리오와 가능성
• Mixed (50개): 통합 사고와 응용

출처 기반 설명:
위 300개 질문은 Greg Satell의 "Mapping Innovation" 책에서 제시하는 Innovation Matrix (혁신 매트릭스) 프레임워크를 바탕으로 구성되었습니다:booktopia+3
핵심 프레임워크: Innovation Matrix의 두 가지 질문oreilly+2
1. "How well is the problem defined?" (문제가 얼마나 잘 정의되었는가?)gregsatell+2
2. "How well is the domain defined?" (도메인/필요한 역량이 얼마나 잘 정의되었는가?)gregsatell+2
네 가지 혁신 유형 (Innovation Matrix의 4 Quadrants)booktopia+4
1. Basic Research (기초 연구): 문제도 도메인도 정의되지 않음 - 완전히 새로운 것을 발견하려는 목표goodreads+1
2. Breakthrough Innovation (돌파구 혁신): 잘 정의된 문제, 정의되지 않은 도메인 - 크로스 도메인 전문성과 오픈 이노베이션이 필요oreilly+4
3. Sustaining Innovation (지속적 혁신): 잘 정의된 문제와 도메인 - 내부 R&D가 효과적, 70-20-10 룰의 70%goodreads+5
4. Disruptive Innovation (파괴적 혁신): 정의되지 않은 문제, 잘 정의된 도메인 - 기존 역량으로 새로운 시장 창출, 10%booktopia+6
추가 핵심 개념
• 70-20-10 Rule: 혁신 포트폴리오 자원 배분 - Core 70%, Adjacent 20%, Transformational 10%itonics-innovation+5
• Platform & Ecosystem Strategy: 외부 인재, 기술, 정보 생태계 접근hbs+5
• Asking Right Questions: 혁신 공간을 매핑하기 위한 올바른 질문의 중요성linkedin+6
이 질문들은 문제 해결 중심 접근, 체계적 혁신 프로세스, 그리고 상황에 맞는 전략 선택의 중요성을 강조하는 Satell의 연구를 반영합니다.
좋습니다, Sean. Greg Satell의 Mapping Innovation 핵심 프레임(문제/도메인 정의 매트릭스, 포트폴리오(지속·파괴·돌파·기초연구), 플랫폼·에코시스템, 탐색/활용, 오픈이노베이션, 도전 과제 정식화, 실험·증거 기반, 확산·스케일, 거버넌스)을 기준으로 Why / How / What if 형식의 챌랜징 질문 500개를 정리했습니다. (20개 카테고리 × 25문항)
1) 혁신 맵 & 전략 정렬 (1–25)
1. Why 우리 조직은 ‘문제-도메인’ 정의 없이 솔루션부터 논의하나?
2. How 모든 이니셔티브를 혁신 매트릭스 4분면에 매핑할까?
3. What if 분기마다 포트폴리오 비중(지속/파괴/돌파/기초)을 재조정하면?
4. Why ‘큰 아이디어’가 실제 고객 문제와 분리되나?
5. How 전략 목표→혁신 과제→지표를 1장 맵으로 연결할까?
6. What if 동일 과제를 서로 다른 분면에서 병렬로 실험하면?
7. Why 혁신 언어가 사업부·재무와 불통인가?
8. How 재무 스토리(현금·IRR)로 혁신 맵을 번역할까?
9. What if ‘맵 없는 프로젝트’는 승인 불가로 하면?
10. Why 단기 ROI가 장기 탐색을 잠식하나?
11. How ‘탐색 예산 하한’과 ‘활용 예산 상한’을 제도화할까?
12. What if 포트폴리오를 경쟁사와 상대 비교해 공표하면?
13. Why 혁신 목표가 ‘신제품 출시’로만 정의되나?
14. How 문제 해결·학습·표준화 등 결과 유형을 구분할까?
15. What if 실패 학습량을 포트폴리오 성과로 인정하면?
16. Why 경영진이 분면 간 트레이드오프를 모호하게 다루나?
17. How 각 분면별 의사결정 원칙·게이트를 따로 둘까?
18. What if ‘맵 업데이트’가 월례 경영회의 1번 안건이면?
19. Why 내부 정치가 맵의 객관성을 훼손하나?
20. How 외부 자문/고객 위원을 맵 검증에 포함할까?
21. What if 모든 사내 공모 아이디어도 맵에 의무 매핑하면?
22. Why KPI가 각 분면 특성(속도/불확실성)을 무시하나?
23. How 선행·후행 지표를 분면별로 다르게 설계할까?
24. What if ‘지도 없는 실행’에 페널티를 부여하면?
25. Why 맵이 벽 포스터로만 남나? How 주간 실행 보드로 전환할까?
2) 문제 정의(Problem Definition) (26–50)
26. Why 우리는 ‘문제의 문제’를 묻지 않나?
27. How 문제를 증상·원인·제약으로 분해할까?
28. What if 문제 문장을 고객 1인칭으로만 쓰게 하면?
29. Why 경영 가설이 데이터로 반증되지 않나?
30. How 반증 가능한 가설·성공 기준을 표준화할까?
31. What if 문제를 ‘과대/과소 정의’ 두 버전으로 병행 실험하면?
32. Why 문제 소유자와 예산 소유자가 다르나?
33. How 예산을 문제 오너에게 귀속시킬까?
34. What if ‘문제-솔루션 Fit 심사’ 없이는 개발 금지하면?
35. Why B2B 구매자/사용자/영향자 구분이 모호한가?
36. How 페르소나별 ‘해야 할 일(Job)’을 계량화할까?
37. What if 고객 여정 마찰 상위 3개 해결 전 신기능 금지?
38. Why 경쟁 대안(사람/엑셀/에이전시)을 과소평가하나?
39. How 대체재 비용곡선을 슬라이드 1장으로 상시 갱신할까?
40. What if 문제를 규제/표준/계약으로 재정의하면?
41. Why 문제 크기를 TAM이 아닌 Bottom-up으로 산정 못하나?
42. How 1년·3년 손실비용(시간/리스크)으로 환산할까?
43. What if ‘문제 명확·도메인 불명’ 전략으로 파트너십을 선행하면?
44. Why 문제 우선순위가 소음에 흔들리나?
45. How 이슈→티켓→가치로 자동 정렬할까?
46. What if ‘해결하면 안 되는 문제’ 리스트를 만들면?
47. Why 문제 정의문에 윤리·공정성 질문이 빠지나?
48. How 공정성 영향평가를 기본 섹션으로 둘까?
49. What if 문제 정의를 고객과 공동 작성·서명하면?
50. How 문제 종료 조건을 사전 명시할까? Why 지연되는가?
3) 도메인 정의(Domain Definition) (51–75)
51. Why 우리 도메인 지식의 경계를 모르는가?
52. How ‘알고 모르는 것’ 지도를 만들까?
53. What if 모르는 도메인을 외부 연구소/대학과 합작하면?
54. Why 표준·프로토콜·규격을 후행적으로만 보나?
55. How 표준화 기구·컨소시엄에 선제 참여할까?
56. What if 도메인 스카우팅(논문/특허/오픈소스)을 월례화하면?
57. Why 내부 용어가 외부 업계와 불일치하나?
58. How 용어사전·데이터 계보를 공개화할까?
59. What if 도메인 전문가를 어드바이저로 스톡옵션 보상하면?
60. Why 도메인 정의가 조직도에 종속되나?
61. How ‘문제 중심’ 크로스펑셔널 도메인을 설계할까?
62. What if 고객사 도메인 팀과 공동 PO를 두면?
63. Why 초기 설계에 규제 전문가가 빠지나?
64. How 규제-기술 동반설계(샌드박스)를 기본 택할까?
65. What if 도메인 미지 영역을 기초연구 분면으로 분리하면?
66. Why 지적재산/라이선스 리스크가 도메인 경계를 막나?
67. How FTO(자유 실시) 평가를 의사결정 게이트로 둘까?
68. What if 핵심 기술을 라이선스-인으로 가속하면?
69. Why 도메인 세분화가 제품 복잡성만 키우나?
70. How 공통 모듈·플랫폼으로 수렴할까?
71. What if 도메인 로드맵을 고객의 연간 계획과 동기화하면?
72. Why 경쟁사 도메인 이동(피벗) 신호를 놓치나?
73. How 특허/채용/오픈소스 활동으로 역추적할까?
74. What if ‘도메인 교차’ 프로젝트를 분기 1회 의무화하면?
75. How 도메인 정의를 가격·계약 구조에 반영할까?
4) 지속적 혁신(Sustaining) (76–100)
76. Why 성능/비용 개선이 고객 경험 개선으로 이어지지 않나?
77. How QoS·NPS·TCO 브리지를 공표할까?
78. What if ‘작은 개선 1%/주’만 KPI로 남기면?
79. Why 릴리즈가 기능 나열인가?
80. How ‘문제→성과’ 사례 중심으로 바꿀까?
81. What if 경쟁과 동일 축 비교를 중단하고 의사결정 맵으로 재배치?
82. Why 고가·저가 라인 간 카니벌리제이션이 통제되지 않나?
83. How 가격·패키징 가드레일을 제도화할까?
84. What if ‘제거 릴리즈’(불필요 기능 삭제) 분기 1회 실행하면?
85. Why 고객 장애·반품·AS 비용을 숨기나?
86. How 실패비용 대시보드를 경영회의 상수로 둘까?
87. What if 품질 크레딧을 자동 지급하면?
88. Why 내부 공정 개선이 고객 가치로 번역되지 않나?
89. How 운영 절감→가격·약속 강화로 전가할까?
90. What if 공동개발 고객에게 성능보증 계약을 도입하면?
91. Why 유지보수·보증이 손실센터인가?
92. How 서비스화로 매출/리텐션을 키울까?
93. What if UX·접근성을 가격 프리미엄의 근거로 삼으면?
94. Why 경쟁의 ‘속도’만 따라가나?
95. How 고객의 ‘시간 절약’으로 차별화할까?
96. What if 공급망/포장 혁신으로 탄소·비용을 동시 절감하면?
97. Why 베타/릴리즈 노트에 트레이드오프가 없나?

499. What if 사내 혁신 뉴스룸을 만들어 투명 운영?
500. How ‘우리는 배움’이라는 정체성을 일과 언어로 제도화할까?
엔젤 투자에서 시리즈 A까지: 300개 Challenging Questions
􊶬􊶨􊶭􊶮􊶯 Executive Summary
이 문서는 스타트업이 엔젤 투자부터 시리즈 A까지 성공적으로 진행하기 위한 300개의 전략적 질문을 체계화했습니다. 각 질문은 Why (근본 원리), How (실행 방법), What If (시나리오)의 프레임워크를 활용하여 깊이 있는 사고를 촉진합니다.
데이터 기반 Context:
• 엔젤 투자: 평균 $100K-$2M, 10-20% equity (출처: Angel Capital Association, 2024)
• 시리즈 A: 평균 $2M-$15M, product-market fit 증명 필수 (출처: Fundz, 2024)
• 시드→시리즈 A 전환율: 약 10% (출처: Founders Forum Group, 2024)
• 평균 시리즈 A 도달 기간: 18-24개월 (출처: Hyde Park Angels, 2024)
PART I: 엔젤 투자 준비 단계 (Pre-Angel Stage)
100 Questions for Foundation Building
Section 1: Product-Market Fit Discovery (25 Questions)
Why Questions (근본 가정 탐구)
1. Why does this problem deserve to exist as a venture-backed business versus a lifestyle company?
2. Why would customers choose your solution over doing nothing at all?
3. Why is this market timing right now, not 5 years ago or 5 years later?
4. Why do you believe this problem is painful enough for customers to change their behavior?
5. Why should investors believe your team is uniquely positioned to solve this problem?
How Questions (실행 메커니즘)
6. How will you validate product-market fit with less than $100K in initial capital?
7. How do you define your "perfect customer" beyond demographic data?
8. How will you measure genuine customer pain versus surface-level interest?
9. How can you test your core value proposition in 30 days or less?
10. How will you distinguish between early adopters and mainstream customers?
What If Questions (시나리오 플래닝)
11. What if your initial hypothesis about customer pain is 50% wrong?
12. What if your target market is 10x smaller than projected?
13. What if a well-funded competitor launches your exact solution tomorrow?
14. What if customers love your product but won't pay for it?
15. What if your solution works, but the unit economics never make sense?
Mixed Strategic Questions
16. Why do 90% of startups fail at product-market fit, and how will you be in the 10%?
17. How will you know when to pivot versus when to persevere?
18. What if achieving product-market fit requires 3x more capital than planned?
19. Why should your target customer trust a startup over established alternatives?
20. How will you create 10x value, not just 10% improvement?
Deep Analytical Questions
21. What leading indicators will signal you're approaching product-market fit?
22. Can you articulate your value proposition in one sentence that a 10-year-old understands?
23. What would have to be true for your solution to achieve $100M ARR?
24. How will you validate willingness to pay before building the full product?
25. What experiments can you run to falsify your core assumptions?
Section 2: Team Building & Founder Dynamics (25 Questions)
Why Questions
26. Why is your founding team uniquely qualified versus the 10,000 other teams in this space?
27. Why did you choose your co-founders, and what complementary skills do they bring?
28. Why should talented people join your company instead of Google/Meta/a safe
job? 29. Why do you personally need to build this company (beyond financial motivation)?
30. Why will your team stay together through the inevitable tough times?
How Questions
31. How have you structured equity splits, and what principle guided those decisions?
32. How will you make key decisions when co-founders disagree?
33. How will you attract world-class advisors with no budget?
34. How do you plan to fill critical skill gaps in the founding team?
35. How will you maintain company culture as you scale from 3 to 30 people?
What If Questions
36. What if a co-founder wants to leave after 6 months?
37. What if you need to fire a founding team member?
38. What if your technical co-founder can't actually build the product?
39. What if investors demand you hire an "adult" CEO?
40. What if your advisory board disagrees with your strategic direction?
Team Dynamics & Governance
41. How have you structured vesting schedules to protect the company?
42. What mechanisms prevent founder conflicts from destroying the company?
43. How will you evaluate adding a fourth or fifth co-founder?
44. What's your strategy for recruiting technical talent in a competitive market?
45. How do you balance founder salary needs with runway extension?
Culture & Values
46. What are your 3-5 non-negotiable company values, and why those?
47. How will you maintain startup agility while building operational discipline?
48. What's your philosophy on remote vs. in-person work for early-stage teams?
49. How will you create a culture that attracts A+ talent consistently?
50. What early cultural decisions could make or break your company in 3 years?
Section 3: Business Model & Unit Economics (25 Questions)
Why Questions
51. Why is your business model defensible against competition and commoditization?
52. Why will customers pay for your solution at the price point you need?
53. Why does your unit economics support venture-scale returns (not just profitability)?
54. Why should investors believe you can achieve 70%+ gross margins?
55. Why is your chosen monetization strategy optimal versus alternatives?
How Questions
56. How will you calculate Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) in the pre-revenue stage?
57. How will you estimate Lifetime Value (LTV) without historical data?
58. How quickly can you achieve a 3:1 LTV:CAC ratio?
59. How will you validate pricing before investing heavily in sales/marketing?
60. How do you plan to improve unit economics as you scale?
What If Questions
61. What if your CAC is 5x higher than projected?
62. What if customer churn is 2x worse than anticipated?
63. What if you need to offer massive discounts to win initial customers?
64. What if achieving breakeven requires 10x more customers than planned?
65. What if your business model requires regulatory changes to be viable?
Financial Modeling
66. What are your assumptions for CAC, LTV, gross margin, and burn rate?
67. How will you achieve "default alive" status versus "default dead"?
68. What's your minimum viable burn rate to reach key milestones?
69. How many months of runway do you need to raise your next round comfortably?
70. What financial metrics will you track weekly in the first 12 months?
Revenue Strategy
71. Will you prioritize revenue growth, user growth, or both—and why?
72. How will you balance free users versus paid customers?
73. What's your strategy for scaling revenue without proportionally scaling costs?
74. How will you create multiple revenue streams without losing focus?
75. What early revenue traction signals product-market fit versus "pity purchases"?
Section 4: Go-to-Market Strategy (25 Questions)
Why Questions
76. Why is your go-to-market strategy capital-efficient versus alternatives?
77. Why did you choose your initial customer segment versus others?
78. Why will your first 100 customers become advocates and references?
79. Why should distribution partners care about your success?
80. Why is your marketing message differentiated in a crowded market?
How Questions
81. How will you acquire your first 10 paying customers with zero marketing budget?
82. How will you create a repeatable, scalable customer acquisition process?
83. How will you leverage content marketing to build authority and generate leads?
84. How do you plan to use founder-led sales before hiring a sales team?
85. How will you track and optimize conversion rates across the funnel?
What If Questions
86. What if your primary customer acquisition channel becomes too expensive?
87. What if your ideal customer profile changes after initial market feedback?
88. What if organic growth is slower than expected?
89. What if paid marketing doesn't work at all for your business?
90. What if you need strategic partnerships to reach customers, but can't secure them?
Channel Strategy
91. What are the top 3 customer acquisition channels you'll test first?
92. How will you create viral loops or network effects in your product?
93. What's your content marketing strategy to build organic traffic?
94. How will you leverage community building as a growth engine?
95. What early indicators will show which channels are working?
Sales & Customer Success
96. How will you convert trial users to paying customers effectively?
97. What's your strategy for reducing sales cycle time?
98. How will you ensure customer success to minimize churn?
99. What automation will you build to scale customer acquisition?
100. How will you create customer advocates who drive referrals?

100 Questions for Traction & Validation

Why Questions

105. Why will you win versus better-funded competitors?
How Questions

108. How do you plan to leverage warm introductions versus cold outreach?
109. How will you handle investor due diligence efficiently?
110. How will you negotiate deal terms to balance dilution and investor value-add?
What If Questions

115. What if the fundraising process takes 6 months longer than expected?
Pitch Mechanics

120. How will you address the biggest risk factors investors will identify?
Investor Relations

125. How will you turn investors into active advisors post-funding?

How Questions

133. How do you plan to reduce customer acquisition cost as you scale?
134. How will you increase customer lifetime value systematically?
135. How will you measure product engagement beyond vanity metrics?
What If Questions
136. What if growth stalls after initial traction?
137. What if your churn rate increases as you scale?

139. What if virality doesn't materialize as expected?
140. What if you need to pivot your entire go-to-market approach?
Metrics & KPIs
141. What are your top 5 KPIs that actually predict long-term success?
142. How will you distinguish between "good growth" and "bad growth"?
143. What cohort analysis will you run to understand retention?
144. How will you track customer satisfaction (NPS, CSAT, etc.)?
145. What early warning signals indicate problems ahead?
Customer Insights
146. How will you systematically gather and act on customer feedback?
147. What percentage of customers are "power users" versus casual users?
148. How will you identify which features drive retention versus acquisition?
149. What customer success stories validate your value proposition?
150. How will you turn customer insights into product roadmap priorities?
Section 7: Product Development & Iteration (25 Questions)
Why Questions
151. Why are you building this feature versus alternatives on the backlog?

155. Why should you invest in engineering excellence now versus moving fast?
How Questions

Engineering Strategy

169. How will you balance product velocity with code quality?

Product Philosophy

200. How will you reduce sales cycle time while maintaining deal quality?

100 Questions for Scale & Market Leadership

How Questions

Metrics Mastery

How Questions

What If Questions

Investment Thesis

Post-Series A Strategy

299. What governance and reporting will you implement for institutional investors?
300. How will you maintain founder vision while accepting VC oversight?
􊶧􊶨􊶩 Key Frameworks for Answering These Questions
1. Data-Driven Validation Framework
• Every answer should reference specific metrics or data points
• Cite industry benchmarks (출처: SaaS Capital, OpenView Partners)
• Use cohort analysis to validate assumptions
• Track leading indicators, not just lagging metrics
2. Scenario Planning Framework
• Base case (70% confidence)
• Best case (20% confidence)
• Worst case (10% confidence)
• Prepare mitigation strategies for each scenario
3. Investor Lens Framework
• Market opportunity (TAM, SAM, SOM)
• Team execution capability
• Product differentiation & moats
• Unit economics & capital efficiency
• Traction & growth trajectory
4. Operational Excellence Framework
• Measure what matters (focus on 5-7 core KPIs)
• Build systems for scale, not just immediate needs
• Create transparency through dashboards
• Implement weekly/monthly review cadences
• Balance growth with financial discipline
􈚘􈚓􈚔􈚕􈚖􈚗 How to Use These 300 Questions
For Founders:
1. Pre-Fundraising Audit: Answer 50 questions most relevant to your current stage
2. Investor Preparation: Anticipate tough questions and prepare data-backed answers
3. Strategic Planning: Use questions to identify blindspots in your strategy
4. Team Alignment: Discuss key questions with co-founders to ensure alignment
For Investors:
1. Due Diligence: Systematically evaluate startups across these dimensions
2. Portfolio Support: Help portfolio companies think through critical issues
3. Pattern Recognition: Identify common failure modes across startups
For Advisors:
1. Coaching Sessions: Guide founders through tough strategic questions
2. Board Meetings: Structure discussions around key decision points
3. Milestone Planning: Help startups set realistic, measurable goals

􊳨􊳩􊳪􊳫􊳬 Final Strategic Insight
성공적인 엔젤→시리즈 A 여정의 핵심은 **"질문에 답하는 능력"이 아니라 "올바른 질문을 던지는 능력"**입니다. 이 300개 질문은:
􈆆􎀱 근본 가정에 도전 (Why 질문) 􈆆􎀱 실행 가능한 메커니즘 설계 (How 질문) 􈆆􎀱 리스크 시나리오 대비 (What If 질문) 􈆆􎀱 데이터 기반 의사결정 촉진 (Mixed 질문)
"In God we trust; all others must bring data." - W. Edwards Deming
이 질문들을 통해 가설을 세우고, 실험하고, 검증하는 과정을 반복하면서 시장이 원하는 제품을 만드는 팀으로 진화하시기 바랍니다.
엔젤 투자 받고 시리즈 A 가고자 하는 기업의 챌랜징 이전과 같이 300개 why, how, what if
ChatGPT의 말:
7s 동안 생각함
좋습니다, Sean. 엔젤 → 시리즈 A 전환을 목표로 하는 스타트업을 위한 챌린징 질문 300개를 아래 20개 카테고리(각 15문항)로 정리했습니다. 각 문항은 [Why] / [How] / [What if] 형식으로 시작하며, 가급적 짧고 날카롭게 설계했습니다.
1) 문제 정의 & 페인 확인 (15)
1. [Why] 지금 이 문제가 반드시 해결돼야 하는 거라면, 왜 지금까지 아무도 제대로 못 했나?
2. [Why] 고객이 겪는 “진짜 비용”은 시간·리스크·기회비용 중 무엇이며 왜 그런가?
3. [Why] 상위 1% 헤비 유저가 아닌 평균 사용자는 왜 이 문제를 심각하게 느끼지 못하나?
4. [How] 고객의 현재 워크어라운드(우회해법)를 정량화하면 어떻게 수치가 나오나?
5. [How] “문제-해결 적합성”을 4주 안에 검증하려면 어떻게 설계하나?
6. [How] 페인 강도를 NPS·CES 외 어떤 보조지표로 계량화하나?

292. [What if] 더 느리지만 견고한 전략이 장기 LTV를 극대화한다면?
293. [How] 정량·정성 리서치를 의사결정 문서로 일원화하는 법은?
294. [Why] 조직이 리스크 테이킹을 회피하는가?
295. [How] 12주 사이클(가설→실험→리뷰)로 전략 학습률을 높이는 방법은?
296. [What if] 경쟁사가 우리보다 먼저 카테고리 리더로 등극하면?
297. [How] 고객 데이터/워크플로 자산화로 전환비용을 구조화하는 법은?
298. [Why] 네트워크 효과가 임계치 아래에서 정체되는가?
299. [How] 지식자산(문서/프로세스/데이터셋)을 축적·활용하는 체계는?
300. [What if] “제품 핵심 정의”를 바꾸면 회사의 정체성은 무엇이 남나?
시리즈 A에서 코스닥 상장까지: 300개 Challenging Questions
􊶬􊶨􊶭􊶮􊶯 Executive Summary
이 문서는 시리즈 A를 마친 스타트업이 코스닥 상장까지 성공적으로 진행하기 위한 300개의 전략적 질문을 체계화했습니다. 한국 시장의 특수성과 글로벌 베스트 프랙티스를 결합하여 구성했습니다.

한국 스타트업 투자 데이터 분석 후 300개 질문 구조화.
좋습니다. 한국 스타트업 투자 데이터를 얻었습니다:
2024-2025 한국 스타트업 투자 통계:
• 2024년 총 투자: 5조 9,562억원 (전년 대비 2.5% 증가)
• 2025년 Q1: 1조 2,363억원 (전년 동기 대비 감소)
• 2025년 Q3: 2조 4,326억원 (152% 급증)
• 시리즈 B 이상 성장 단계 투자 증가
• AI, B2B SaaS, 친환경 기술 중심
이제 문서를 작성하겠습니다. 구조는:
PART I: 시리즈 A → B (100 questions)
• Scaling Product-Market Fit
• Revenue Growth Engine
• Team & Org Development
• Unit Economics Optimization
PART II: 시리즈 B → C/D (100 questions)
• Hypergrowth Management
• Market Leadership
• International Expansion
• Pre-IPO Foundation
PART III: IPO 준비 및 코스닥 상장 (100 questions)
• Financial & Governance Readiness
• IPO Execution
• Public Market Transition
• Post-IPO Strategy
각 섹션마다 Why, How, What If, Mixed 질문을 균형있게 배치하겠습니다.
한국 시장 핵심 데이터:
• 2024년 스타트업 투자: 5조 9,562억원, 1,615건 (출처: 스타트업레시피, 2025)
• 2025년 Q3: 2조 4,326억원 (전분기 대비 152% 증가) (출처: THE VC, 2025)
• 시리즈 B+ 성장단계 투자 증가 추세
• 평균 시리즈 A→상장: 5-7년 (글로벌 기준)
• 코스닥 상장 기준 매출: 최소 30억~300억원 규모 (출처: 한국거래소, 2024)
PART I: 시리즈 A에서 시리즈 B로 (Series A → B Growth Stage)
100 Questions for Scaling Excellence
Section 1: Scaling Product-Market Fit (25 Questions)
Why Questions (근본 가정 재검증)
1. Why has your product-market fit at seed stage proven sustainable at 10x scale?
2. Why do customers continue to pay as you expand beyond early adopters?
3. Why should investors believe your PMF extends to new customer segments?
4. Why is your retention curve flattening (indicating strong PMF) versus declining?
5. Why will your value proposition remain differentiated as you scale?
How Questions (스케일링 메커니즘)
6. How will you maintain product quality while 10x-ing user base in 12 months?
7. How do you plan to segment customers for tailored value propositions?
8. How will you measure product-market fit across different customer cohorts?
9. How will you balance feature expansion versus core product excellence?
10. How do you plan to scale customer support without degrading experience?
What If Questions (스케일 리스크)
11. What if product-market fit weakens as you move upmarket to enterprise?
12. What if your "wow moment" dilutes with rapid user growth?
13. What if customer success metrics decline as you scale faster?
14. What if new customer segments require fundamentally different products?
15. What if scaling reveals hidden product flaws invisible at small scale?
Strategic Integration Questions
16. What is your Net Promoter Score (NPS), and how will you improve it to 50+?
17. How will you create "aha moments" for 100,000 users as effectively as for 1,000?
18. What early warning indicators signal PMF erosion during rapid scaling?
19. How will you maintain founder involvement in customer feedback loops?
20. What percentage of users reach "power user" status, and how will you increase it?
Data-Driven Questions
21. What is your current D1/D7/D30 retention, and how does it compare to best-in-class?
22. How will you track cohort-level PMF to catch segment-specific issues?
23. What usage metrics best predict long-term customer value?
24. How will you A/B test product changes without disrupting core experience?
25. What customer feedback mechanisms scale beyond founder-led conversations?
Section 2: Revenue Growth Engine (25 Questions)
Why Questions
26. Why can you confidently project 3-5x revenue growth over the next 18 months?
27. Why is your current revenue growth sustainable versus artificially inflated?
28. Why will customers continue to expand spending (net dollar retention >100%)?
29. Why should investors believe you can reach $10M ARR profitably?
30. Why is your monetization strategy optimized for scale?
How Questions
31. How will you build a repeatable, scalable sales process for Series B readiness?
32. How do you plan to achieve 3:1 LTV:CAC ratio while scaling acquisition?
33. How will you transition from founder-led sales to a sales team?
34. How will you implement pricing tiers that maximize revenue per customer?
35. How do you plan to reduce customer acquisition costs as you scale?
What If Questions
36. What if revenue growth requires unprofitable customer acquisition?
37. What if your pricing model doesn't support venture-scale margins?
38. What if competitors launch price wars that compress margins?
39. What if enterprise sales cycles are 2x longer than anticipated?
40. What if you need to pivot monetization strategy mid-scale?
Revenue Metrics Mastery
41. What is your current MRR/ARR growth rate, and is it accelerating?
42. What is your revenue retention (gross vs. net), and how will you improve it?
43. How will you expand revenue from existing customers (upsell/cross-sell)?
44. What is your average contract value (ACV), and should you move upmarket?
45. What percentage of revenue comes from top 10 customers (concentration risk)?
Sales Excellence
46. How will you build a predictable sales pipeline with 3x coverage?
47. What is your sales cycle length, and how will you reduce it by 30%?
48. How will you implement sales enablement to scale rep productivity?
49. What is your win rate, and what must improve to reach 30%+?
50. How will you balance inbound versus outbound sales motions?
Section 3: Team & Organizational Development (25 Questions)
Why Questions
51. Why is your current leadership team capable of managing 100+ employees?
52. Why should top-tier talent join your Series A company versus alternatives?
53. Why will your company culture survive the transition from 30 to 100 people?
54. Why do you need (or not need) to hire C-level executives now?
55. Why should investors trust your hiring plan and timeline?
How Questions
56. How will you recruit 50+ high-quality employees in 18 months?
57. How do you plan to build functional leadership teams (sales, eng, product, marketing)?
58. How will you onboard new employees to maintain culture and productivity?
59. How will you implement performance management at scale?
60. How do you plan to retain top performers during rapid growth?
What If Questions
61. What if you can't recruit VP-level talent at your current compensation budget?
62. What if key executives don't perform and need replacement?
63. What if rapid hiring dilutes company culture irreparably?
64. What if remote work reduces collaboration and slows execution?
65. What if high-growth stress causes founder burnout?
Organizational Design
66. What organizational structure will you implement for 100-person team?
67. How will you prevent siloed departments that reduce cross-functional collaboration?
68. What communication cadence will maintain alignment across growing teams?
69. How will you implement OKRs to cascade strategy across the organization?
70. What early organizational debt are you accumulating that must be addressed?
Culture & Values at Scale
71. How will you operationalize company values beyond posters on walls?
72. What rituals and traditions will reinforce culture during hypergrowth?
73. How will you maintain founder accessibility as the team grows?
74. What employee engagement metrics will you track quarterly?
75. How will you address toxic behaviors before they metastasize?
Section 4: Unit Economics Optimization (25 Questions)
Why Questions
76. Why are your unit economics better than competitors at similar scale?
77. Why should investors believe your margins will improve, not compress?
78. Why is your current burn rate justified by growth velocity?
79. Why will you achieve Rule of 40 within 24 months?
80. Why is your capital efficiency superior to industry benchmarks?
How Questions
81. How will you improve gross margin from current levels to 70%+?
82. How do you plan to reduce CAC by 30% through channel optimization?
83. How will you increase LTV through product enhancements and upsells?
84. How will you implement rigorous financial discipline without stifling growth?
85. How do you plan to extend runway to 24+ months post-Series A?
What If Questions
86. What if achieving profitability requires sacrificing growth velocity?
87. What if customer acquisition costs rise faster than LTV improvements?
88. What if you need to raise a bridge round before Series B?
89. What if market conditions force down-round or flat valuation?
90. What if unit economics never support profitable scaling?
Financial Modeling
91. What is your current burn multiple (cash burned / net new ARR)?
92. How many months until you achieve break-even at current trajectory?
93. What is your cash efficiency score (growth rate / burn rate)?
94. How will you balance growth investment versus path to profitability?
95. What financial scenarios have you modeled (best/base/worst case)?
Capital Strategy
96. How much Series B capital will you need, and what milestones will it fund?
97. What valuation range is justified by your traction and market opportunity?
98. How will you position yourself to top-tier Series B investors?
99. What are your fundraising success criteria (amount, valuation, investor quality)?
100. How will you manage dilution while still raising adequate capital?
PART II: 시리즈 B에서 C/D로 (Series B → C/D Scale-Up Stage)
100 Questions for Hypergrowth Mastery
Section 5: Hypergrowth Management (25 Questions)
Why Questions
101. Why can your infrastructure support 10x growth in next 24 months?
102. Why is your team capable of executing a hypergrowth strategy?
103. Why will your margins improve (not erode) during rapid scaling?
104. Why should investors believe you can reach $50M-$100M ARR?
105. Why is now the right time to press the growth accelerator?
How Questions
106. How will you maintain 100%+ year-over-year growth sustainably?
107. How do you plan to scale operations without proportional cost increases?
108. How will you implement systems and processes for a 300+ person company?
109. How will you manage cash flow during hypergrowth phase?
110. How do you plan to prevent organizational chaos during rapid scaling?
What If Questions
111. What if hypergrowth exposes critical infrastructure limitations?
112. What if quality and customer satisfaction decline during rapid expansion?
113. What if you grow too fast and outpace your ability to execute?
114. What if the team burns out from sustained hypergrowth pressure?
115. What if competitors respond aggressively to your market dominance?
Operational Excellence
116. What systems will you implement to maintain visibility across the organization?
117. How will you scale customer success to maintain NPS >40 at 10x volume?
118. What automation will you build to improve operational efficiency?
119. How will you manage technical debt that accumulates during hypergrowth?
120. What early warning indicators signal operational stress?
Growth Strategy
121. What is your T2D3 roadmap (Triple, Triple, Double, Double, Double)?
122. How will you expand product lines without losing focus?
123. What new customer segments will you target for expansion?
124. How will you leverage data and AI to accelerate growth?
125. What strategic acquisitions might accelerate your roadmap?
Section 6: Market Leadership & Competitive Positioning (25 Questions)
Why Questions
126. Why will you become the category leader, not a strong #2 or #3?
127. Why should customers switch from incumbents to your solution at scale?
128. Why can't well-funded competitors replicate your success?
129. Why is your brand recognition growing faster than competitors?
130. Why should strategic acquirers view you as indispensable?
How Questions
131. How will you achieve 30%+ market share in your core segment?
132. How do you plan to build defensible moats (network effects, data, etc.)?
133. How will you leverage thought leadership for market dominance?
134. How will you respond to competitive threats without losing focus?
135. How do you plan to create switching costs that lock in customers?
What If Questions
136. What if a tech giant (Naver, Kakao, Samsung) enters your market?
137. What if competitors consolidate through M&A against you?
138. What if your differentiation becomes commoditized quickly?
139. What if market leadership requires unprofitable pricing?
140. What if regulatory changes favor incumbents over startups?
Competitive Intelligence
141. Who are your top 5 competitors, and what's changing in their strategies?
142. What would you do if you were leading your biggest competitor?
143. How will you monitor competitive moves and respond rapidly?
144. What will you do 10x better than anyone else in the market?
145. What indicators show you're winning versus losing competitively?
Strategic Positioning
146. How will you own your category through brand and messaging?
147. What partnerships will create strategic advantages?
148. How will you leverage customer success stories for competitive advantage?
149. What industry analysts and media outlets will you cultivate?
150. How will you prepare for potential acquisition offers (accept or decline)?
Section 7: International Expansion (25 Questions)
Why Questions (한국 기업의 글로벌 확장)
151. Why is international expansion critical versus staying Korea-focused?
152. Why should you expand to Southeast Asia, US, or Europe first?
153. Why will your product-market fit translate to international markets?
154. Why is now the right timing for global expansion?
155. Why should international investors back your expansion plans?
How Questions
156. How will you select target markets for international expansion?
157. How do you plan to localize product, marketing, and operations?
158. How will you recruit and manage international teams?
159. How will you navigate regulatory and compliance requirements?
160. How do you plan to fund international expansion efficiently?
What If Questions
161. What if international expansion burns cash without ROI?
162. What if cultural differences prevent product-market fit abroad?
163. What if regulatory barriers block market entry?
164. What if managing international operations diverts focus from core market?
165. What if competitors are already dominant in target markets?
Market Entry Strategy
166. What criteria will guide international market selection?
167. How will you test market viability before full commitment?
168. What entry mode will you choose (direct, partnership, acquisition)?
169. How will you balance Korea market dominance versus global growth?
170. What mistakes from other Korean startups will you avoid?
Operational Globalization
171. How will you manage multi-timezone operations effectively?
172. What technology infrastructure supports global operations?
173. How will you maintain company culture across international offices?
174. What financial systems will you implement for multi-currency operations?
175. How will you attract global talent to join a Korea-based startup?
Section 8: Pre-IPO Foundation Building (25 Questions)
Why Questions (코스닥 상장 준비)
176. Why is IPO your optimal path versus staying private longer?
177. Why will you choose KOSDAQ versus KOSPI or overseas listing?
178. Why should public market investors be excited about your company?
179. Why is your business model suitable for public market scrutiny?
180. Why will you succeed where many tech IPOs have failed?
How Questions
181. How will you build financial infrastructure for public company readiness?
182. How do you plan to implement governance for public company standards?
183. How will you prepare for quarterly earnings pressure?
184. How will you build relationships with institutional investors?
185. How do you plan to select underwriters and advisors?
What If Questions
186. What if you're not ready for IPO within your planned timeline?
187. What if market conditions make IPO unattractive (low valuations)?
188. What if profitability requirements delay listing by 12+ months?
189. What if public market multiples are 50% below private valuations?
190. What if regulatory changes tighten listing requirements?
Financial Readiness
191. What revenue and profitability milestones must you achieve for IPO?
192. How will you transition to IFRS accounting standards?
193. What audit and internal controls must you implement?
194. How will you build financial planning and reporting systems?
195. What historical financials need restatement or cleanup?
Governance & Compliance
196. How will you restructure board composition for public company?
197. What committees (audit, compensation, nominating) will you establish?
198. How will you implement SOX-equivalent internal controls?
199. What disclosure policies and procedures must you create?
200. How will you manage insider trading policies and blackout periods?
PART III: IPO 준비 및 코스닥 상장 (IPO Preparation & KOSDAQ Listing)
100 Questions for Public Market Success
Section 9: Financial & Operational Readiness (25 Questions)
Why Questions (재무 적격성)
201. Why do your financials support a successful KOSDAQ listing?
202. Why should investors pay a premium valuation for your IPO?
203. Why is your revenue quality (recurring, predictable) superior?
204. Why will you maintain growth post-IPO despite quarterly pressures?
205. Why is your path to sustained profitability credible?
How Questions
206. How will you achieve KOSDAQ listing requirements (출처: 한국거래소 상장규정)?
• 자본금 최소 4억원
• 매출액 기준 (일반: 300억+, 기술기업: 특례 가능)
• 시가총액 기준 충족
207. How will you demonstrate 3-year financial track record with clean audits?
208. How do you plan to manage earnings to meet guidance without manipulation?
209. How will you build financial systems for real-time reporting?
210. How will you transition from VC metrics to GAAP/IFRS metrics?
What If Questions
211. What if you fail to meet KOSDAQ profitability requirements?
212. What if auditors issue qualified opinions on historical financials?
213. What if revenue quality issues emerge during due diligence?
214. What if you need to delay IPO by 6-12 months?
215. What if pre-IPO investors demand liquidity through secondary sales?
Financial Performance Metrics
216. What is your 3-year revenue CAGR, and how does it compare to industry?
217. What is your EBITDA margin trajectory toward profitability?
218. What is your free cash flow, and when will it turn positive?
219. What is your working capital management, and how will you optimize it?
220. What one-time charges or adjustments must be disclosed?
Accounting & Audit
221. How will you select Big 4 audit firm for credibility?
222. What accounting policy changes are needed for IFRS compliance?
223. How will you remediate any material weaknesses in internal controls?
224. What historical financial restatements might be required?
225. How will you manage audit costs (typically $500K-$2M for IPO)?
Section 10: Governance, Compliance & Legal (25 Questions)
Why Questions (지배구조 및 투명성)

227. Why should investors trust your management team with public capital?
228. Why is your related-party transaction policy appropriate?
229. Why will you maintain founder control post-IPO (or not)?
230. Why is your intellectual property position defensible?
How Questions
231. How will you structure board composition (independent directors >50%)?
232. How do you plan to implement audit committee with financial experts?
233. How will you establish compensation committee for executive pay?
234. How will you create disclosure controls and procedures?
235. How do you plan to manage shareholder communications?
What If Questions
236. What if governance issues block listing approval?
237. What if related-party transactions require restructuring?
238. What if IP ownership disputes emerge pre-IPO?
239. What if founder lock-up requirements are longer than expected?
240. What if regulatory investigations arise during IPO process?
Legal & Compliance

242. How will you clean up cap table (exercise options, convert notes, etc.)?
243. What litigation or disputes must be resolved pre-IPO?
244. How will you implement insider trading policies?
245. What regulatory licenses or approvals are required?
Shareholder Management
246. How will you negotiate lock-up periods with existing shareholders?
247. What secondary liquidity will you provide to early employees/investors?
248. How will you prevent overhang from large blocks dumping post-lockup?
249. What dividend policy will you establish (or not)?
250. How will you manage activist investors or hostile shareholders?
Section 11: IPO Execution Strategy (25 Questions)
Why Questions (상장 실행)
251. Why is KOSDAQ the optimal listing venue versus KOSPI or Nasdaq?

253. Why is your IPO timing optimal (market conditions, company readiness)?
254. Why will retail investors be excited to participate?
255. Why should underwriters prioritize your deal versus others?
How Questions
256. How will you select lead underwriter (삼성증권, 미래에셋, NH투자증권 등)?
257. How do you plan to determine IPO valuation and price range?
258. How will you execute roadshow to institutional investors?
259. How will you allocate shares between institutional and retail investors?
260. How do you plan to create demand and prevent under-subscription?
What If Questions

262. What if market volatility spikes during IPO window?
263. What if competing IPOs drain investor appetite?
264. What if underwriters propose valuation 30% below expectations?
265. What if retail investor demand overwhelms institutional allocation?
Pricing & Allocation

267. How will you justify premium valuation versus industry averages?
268. What is your target IPO size (자금 조달 목표액)?
269. How will you balance price maximization versus successful aftermarket?
270. What greenshoe option will you structure (typically 15%)?
Marketing & Roadshow
271. How will you craft equity story that resonates with investors?
272. What key metrics will you highlight (growth, margins, TAM, etc.)?
273. How will you differentiate from other tech IPOs?
274. What institutional investors will you target (연기금, 보험사, 자산운용사)?
275. How will you leverage media coverage for IPO awareness?
Section 12: Post-IPO Management & Success (25 Questions)
Why Questions (상장 후 관리)
276. Why will your stock outperform in the first year post-IPO?

284. How will you prevent stock price volatility from distracting team?
285. How do you plan to maintain company culture as public company?
What If Questions

288. What if lockup expiration causes massive selloff?
289. What if short sellers target your stock?

Investor Relations Excellence

292. What quarterly reporting cadence and format will you establish?
293. How will you conduct earnings calls professionally?
294. What investor conferences will you attend (Morgan Stanley, Goldman, etc.)?
295. How will you respond to analyst questions and concerns?
Long-Term Value Creation
296. What 3-5 year strategic plan will you communicate to public markets?
297. How will you allocate IPO proceeds for maximum shareholder value?
298. What M&A strategy will you pursue with public currency?
299. How will you return value to shareholders (dividends, buybacks)?
300. What metrics will you track to ensure sustained public market success?
􊶧􊶨􊶩 KOSDAQ 상장 핵심 체크리스트
정량적 요건 (2024년 개정 기준)
주식 분산 요건 (택1):
• 트랙 1: 공모주식수 ≥ 10%, 소액주주 1,000인 이상
• 트랙 2: 공모주식수 ≥ 20%, 소액주주 500인 이상
• 트랙 3: 공모주식수 ≥ 30%, 소액주주 300인 이상
재무 요건 (택1):
􈆆􈆊 수익성·매출액 기준
• 최근 사업연도 매출액 30억원 이상
• 법인세비용차감전 계속사업이익 10억원 이상
• 자본금 10억원 이상
􈆆􈆋 시장평가·성장성 기준
• 공모후 시가총액 250억원 이상
• 최근 사업연도 매출액 30억원 이상
• 자기자본 30억원 이상
􈆆􈆌 기술평가 특례 (혁신기업)
• 기술신용평가기관 평가 통과
• 공모후 시가총액 100억원 이상
• 최근 사업연도 매출액 10억원 이상
질적 요건 (필수)
􈆆􎀱 기업 계속성: 영업, 재무상황, 경영환경 지속가능성 􈆆􎀱 경영 투명성: 지배구조, 내부통제, 공시체제, 특수관계인 거래 􈆆􎀱 경영 안정성: 지분구조 안정성, 변동 내역 􈆆􎀱 상법 적격성: 상법상 주식회사 요건 􈆆􎀱 감사의견: 최근 3년 적정 의견
상장 심사 기간
• 예비심사: 신청 후 40영업일 (2개월)
• 본심사: 예비심사 승인 후 20영업일
• 총 소요기간: 약 3-6개월
(출처: 한국거래소 코스닥시장 상장규정, 2024)

6개월 전

􊳨􊳩􊳪􊳫􊳬 Final Strategic Framework
성공적인 시리즈 A → 코스닥 상장의 핵심은 **"3가지 전환(Transformation)"**입니다:
􈆆􈆊 Business Model Transformation (비즈니스 모델 전환)
• PMF 검증 → 시장 지배력 확보
• 실험적 성장 → 예측 가능한 성장
• 창업자 영업 → 조직화된 세일즈
􈆆􈆋 Organizational Transformation (조직 전환)
• 스타트업 문화 → 기업 거버넌스
• 직관적 의사결정 → 데이터 기반 의사결정
• 비공식 프로세스 → 제도화된 시스템
􈆆􈆌 Capital Strategy Transformation (자본 전략 전환)
• VC 의존 → 공모시장 접근
• 성장 최우선 → 성장과 수익성 균형
• 비상장 자유도 → 공시 의무와 투명성
􋝙􋝚􋝞􋝟􋝛􋝜􋝝 실행 원칙
이 300개 질문을 활용하는 5가지 원칙:
1. Stage-Appropriate Focus (단계별 집중)
• 현재 단계 질문 50개 + 다음 단계 질문 30개 + 미래 단계 질문 20개
2. Monthly Review Cadence (월별 점검)
• 경영진 회의에서 10-15개 핵심 질문 심도있게 논의
3. Investor Preparation (투자자 대비)
• 다음 라운드 전 100개 질문에 대한 명확한 답변 준비
4. Team Alignment (팀 정렬)
• 핵심 질문을 부서별 OKR과 연결
5. Honest Self-Assessment (정직한 자기평가)
• "모른다"는 답변이 개선의 시작점
"The quality of your questions determines the quality of your answers. The quality of your answers determines the quality of your IPO."
이 300개 질문을 통해 검증된 성장 → 지속가능한 수익성 → 성공적인 공개시장 진입의 여정을 완수하시기 바랍니다.
Sean님의 21개 전문가 페르소나 중 활용된 관점:
• #6 혁신 경영전략 최고 레벨 컨설턴트 (전략적 프레임워크)
• #14 Principal Global Startup Consultant (글로벌 벤치마크)
• #16 VP of Innovation (수익 모델 및 상장 전략)
• #19 대학 총장 (재정 건전성 및 거버넌스)
• #20 하버드 법대 전문가 (상장 규제 및 컴플라이언스)

ChatGPT의 말:
18s 동안 생각함
좋습니다, Sean. 코스닥(KOSDAQ) 상장(예비심사→상장→사후 공시)까지 준비하는 스타트업/중견사를 위한 챌랜징 질문 300개를 20개 카테고리×각 15문항으로 정리했습니다. 형식은 모두 **[Why] / [How] / [What if]**로 시작하며, 실무 결정을 바로 자극하도록 짧고 날카롭게 구성했습니다.
1) 상장 트랙 & 자격 전략 (일반/기술특례/성장성 특례) — 15
1. [Why] 우리 회사가 일반요건보다 기술특례/성장성 특례가 더 유리한 근거는 무엇인가?
2. [How] 두 트랙의 심사 포인트(수익성 vs 성장성/기술성)를 데이터로 비교 정리하는 법은?
3. [What if] 기술평가 등급이 목표치보다 한 단계 낮게 나오면 플랜 B는?
4. [Why] 시장가치 요건 충족을 가로막는 핵심 가정은 무엇인가?
5. [How] 자본잠식/누적결손 해소 로드맵을 분기 단위로 제시하는 방법은?
6. [What if] 주력 사업이 아닌 신규 BU로 성장성 특례를 노린다면 리스크는?
7. [Why] 동종상장 사례 대비 우리 스토리가 희소하지 못한가?
8. [How] 상장 요건 충족 시점(분기/연도)을 역산한 KPI 달력 설계는?
9. [What if] 외부 변수로 직전 연도 실적이 하회하면 심사 대응은?
10. [Why] 컨버전스(전환청구/RCPS) 구조가 요건 충족을 왜곡하는가?
11. [How] 기술특례 이원평가기관 선정 기준을 정량화하는 법은?
12. [What if] 핵심 가설이 기술성은 높고 사업성은 낮게 평가되면?
13. [Why] 상장 시점이 경쟁사 빅 이슈와 충돌하면 불리한가?
14. [How] 상장 전 사업부 분할/물적분할의 득실을 수치화하는 방법은?
15. [What if] 상장 연기를 선택하면 투자자·직원·거래처 신뢰 관리 방안은?
2) 회계·재무(K-IFRS) 정합성 — 15
16. [Why] 매출 인식(장기계약/주문형/라이선스)이 K-IFRS 15와 불일치할 소지가 있나?
17. [How] 변동대가·환불·리베이트 처리 기준을 회계정책서로 명문화하는 법은?
18. [What if] 재고/미수금 충당금이 상향되면 이익률 민감도는?
19. [Why] 자회사/관계기업 연결 범위 판단에 회색지대가 존재하는가?
20. [How] R&D 자산화/비용화 기준을 외부감사와 사전 정렬하는 방법은?
21. [What if] 회계추정 변경이 예측지표(KPI)를 왜곡하면?
22. [Why] 외화환산·헤지회계가 실적 변동성을 키우는가?
23. [How] 분기별 마감속도(Fast Close)와 오류율을 동시에 개선하는 법은?
24. [What if] 사후공시 전 회계오류 정정(정정공시) 발생 시 신뢰회복 플랜은?
25. [Why] 비경상 이익/손실 의존도가 높은가?
26. [How] 부채·우선주·전환증권의 분류(부채/자본) 리스크를 제거하는 법은?
27. [What if] 주석공시 요구가 늘어 리소스 병목이 생기면?
28. [Why] 내부거래 공시 범위 판단이 느슨한가?
29. [How] 관리회계(사업부별 P/L)와 재무회계를 연결하는 대시보드는?
30. [What if] 감사의견 한정 가능성이 포착되면 일정/구조를 어떻게 수정하나?
3) 지배구조 & 이사회 — 15
31. [Why] 사외이사/감사(위원회) 구성의 독립성이 투자자 설득에 부족한가?
32. [How] 전·현 경영진 이해상충(특수관계·계열사)을 맵핑·차단하는 법은?
33. [What if] 상장 직전 지분 재편이 공정거래/공시 이슈를 유발하면?
34. [Why] 주식매수선택권(스톡옵션) 부여가 과도/불균형한가?
35. [How] 이사회 연간 캘린더(전략·보상·감사·리스크)를 운영화하는 방법은?
36. [What if] 창업자 CEO→전문경영인 체제로 전환하면?
37. [Why] 대주주 담보·차입이 상장 신뢰를 약화시키는가?
38. [How] 보상정책을 성과연동·주주친화 구조로 재설계하는 법은?
39. [What if] 주주 간 계약이 공시·의결권 쟁점을 만들면?
40. [Why] 내부통제기준서·업무분장 규정의 실제 이행이 느슨한가?
41. [How] ESG/컴플라이언스를 이사회 위원회로 제도화하는 방법은?
42. [What if] 내부자거래 의혹이 제기될 때 조사·공시 프로토콜은?
43. [Why] 이사회 의사록/평가가 형식화되는가?
44. [How] 독립 사외이사 후보군을 산업 전문성 기준으로 풀링하는 법은?
45. [What if] 감사위원회 설치 전환 시 비용·효익은?
4) 내부회계관리제도(ICFR) & 통제 — 15
46. [How] 핵심 프로세스(수익·구매·재고·IT 일반통제)의 위험/통제를 매핑하는 법은?
47. [Why] ERP 권한·접근통제·로그감사가 미흡한가?
48. [What if] 설계는 양호하나 운영효과성이 미흡 판정되면?
49. [How] 결산·공시 패키지 표준화로 오류율을 줄이는 방법은?
50. [Why] 수기·엑셀 의존 구간이 잔존하는가?
51. [How] 중요성 판단·표본추출 기준을 외부감사인과 사전 합의하는 법은?
52. [What if] 내부제보(whistleblowing) 접수 시 조사·격리 절차는?
53. [How] ITGC(변경관리·백업·DR) 성숙도를 끌어올리는 실행안은?
54. [Why] 공급망·해외법인 통제가 블라인드스팟인가?
55. [How] 키 컨트롤 자동화·연계 테스트를 분기 루틴화하는 방법은?
56. [What if] 중요 약점(Material Weakness) 식별 시 상장일정 영향은?
57. [How] 교육/평가/리미디에이션 PMO를 운영하는 법은?
58. [Why] 데이터 거버넌스(정합성·보존)가 문서화만 되고 실행이 약한가?
59. [How] 감사위원회 보고 라인을 강화하는 구조는?
60. [What if] 내부통제 성숙도 등급을 투자자 프레임에 담아내면?
5) 기술평가·IP·R&D — 15
61. [Why] 특허 포트폴리오가 회피 가능성/무효 가능성에 취약한가?
62. [How] 기술성·사업성을 분리해 KPI·로드맵으로 재구성하는 법은?
63. [What if] 핵심 특허가 경쟁사에 의해 IPR/소송에 직면하면?
64. [Why] 논문·데이터셋·임상/필드 테스트의 증거력이 약한가?
65. [How] TRL(Technology Readiness Level) 증거를 객관화하는 방법은?
66. [What if] 오픈소스 의존으로 라이선스 리스크가 확대되면?
67. [Why] 모델/알고리즘 성능이 비즈 KPI와 연결되지 못하나?
68. [How] 데이터 적법성(수집·처리·국외이전) 체계를 계약·시스템에 내재화하는 법은?
